content.question: If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="f of x equals x plus 1 divided by x"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbGaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaGaeyypa0JaamiEaiabgUcaRmaa laaapaqaa8qacaaIXaaapaqaa8qacaWG4baaaaaa@3E42@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> , then the set of values for which f increases is

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="the union of the sets open parentheses negative infinity, 0 close parentheses and open parentheses 0, infinity close parentheses"> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>∪</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaGGOaGaeyOeI0IaeyOhIuQaaiilaiaaicdacaGGPaGaeyOkIGSa aiikaiaaicdacaGGSaGaeyOhIuQaaiykaaaa@410B@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing
